title: Customized Corporate Blended Learning Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and at least three years of practical experience in relevant fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: Conducted in a BYOD environment, including customized case studies reflecting individual learners’ job characteristics.

learning_goals: Analyze components of blended learning models (print materials, live lectures, online modules) and design strategies applicable to corporate environments.

Learners can complete pre-learning materials (3 modules), two live sessions, and one on-site application activity within a week, then evaluate the interconnectedness of each activity using a 5-point Likert scale, achieve an average score of 4.0 or higher, and propose at least three knowledge transfer system improvement plans based on the evaluation results.

Learners can perform small-group projects (3–4 members) using Google Workspace and Miro, submit a 5-minute presentation and at least three visual collaboration outputs (e.g., Miro board, shared documents), and achieve 70+ points (out of 100) based on peer and instructor evaluation criteria (30% presentation structure, 30% collaboration effectiveness, 40% output completeness).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
